title: Stylish 1BD w Private Garden (Jul 16 - Aug 13)
description:
Renting out my stylish one-bedroom apartment, available from July 15th until Aug 13rd. This is a real one-of-a-kind apartment in Philly that includes a skyline view, bohemian design, and an unexpected surprise: a private patio/garden right off the bedroom (it’s amazing to wake up to).
The apartment is on South Street, situated between the Washington Square West and Italian Market neighborhoods with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby (Whole Foods and Acme are a 2-min walk).
Here’s what you need to know:
I am looking for a responsible person who will commit to regularly watering the patio garden, as well as the indoor plants as needed. It’s not complicated, but it’s very important to me!
The apartment has a dishwasher, garbage disposal, and central A/C, but does not have a washer/dryer. Luckily, there is a great laundromat two doors down, and they also have very reasonable prices for wash-and-fold service.
The place has tons of character and charm, but if you're looking for a "modern luxury" apartment, this is not it! It's a pre-war walkup, no doorman, old-school kind of place.
Parking: There is metered street parking right out front, and you can reliably find non-metered parking a few blocks south of the apartment.

title: Olde Kensington Townhouse - 4 Bed/1 Bath - Available 8/01
description:
UPDATED PICTURES TO COME.
New paint (all white), floors (chestnut) and light fixtures throughout!
Welcome home to this 4 bedroom, 1 bath, corner situated, 3 story, brick front property that is 17 feet wide, offering over 1,900 square feet of living space, and includes a lovely private yard.
This main level's impressive size allows endless possibilities for all styles and sizes of furnishings.
The kitchen, located in the rear of the home has terra-cotta tiled floors and includes a gas range, stainless refrigerator, dishwasher, and access to the rear yard making grill to table cooking a year round experience.
The yard is an urban hide away with plenty of room for plantings in the raised garden and the side alleyway is not shared making outdoor storage very convenient.
Back inside to the upper levels enjoy 4 extremely large bedrooms; perfect for office, den, guest bedrooms etc!
The 2nd floor has 2 bedrooms and a large hall bath. The front bedroom has a beautiful marble mantle and a double wide built in closet and the middle bedroom has a large built in closet as well.
The 3rd floor includes 2 equally spacious bedrooms. The front bedroom has a double wide wardrobe with glass slider doors that have built-in led lights.
The luxury of having so many rooms at your disposal creates an opportunity to craft a living space that fits your needs such as a home office, guest rooms, a studio, a den, study, etc.
The location is a walkers paradise as well since it is in close proximity to a variety of restaurants, cafes, shopping, and social spots in Old Kensington, Fishtown, and Northern Liberties such as Helm, Taco Riendo, Luna Cafe, Reanimator, Front St Cafe, Suraya, Streetside, Hook & Master, Punch Buggy, Laser Wolf, Etc.This home is incredibly close to SEPTA and minutes from Center City.
Available August 2022
First, last, and security due at lease signing
Water included
Pets negotiable

title: WHY rent when you can OWN?

Many renters think they don’t have enough money to buy a house when in reality if you’re paying $1000 or more in rent, then you may qualify for a mortgage and buy a home.

If you’re considering purchasing a home or want to know more about the home buying process feel free to reach out to me!
Kaylin Williams, REALTOR®

title: Many people know Mill Hill as a very special section of Trenton with h
description: Many people know Mill Hill as a very special section of Trenton with historic district protection and pride. It is a charming area where brick sidewalks and historic row houses look much like the streets of Georgetown. What's more of a secret is that a handful of these renovated gems overlook the gentle waters of Assunpink Creek. This rare freestanding home hides sun-dappled gardens, stone walkways and brick patios that step down to a view that seems almost impossible. How can such natural serenity exist in the city? The interior of the house is just as intriguing with 19th century details catching the eye at every turn. A vestibule entry buffers the opened up living/dining room with a gas fireplace and 5 large windows. The eat-in kitchen with hidden laundry joins a screened porch, so you can enjoy that magical setting in nearly any weather. A perfectly positioned skylight leads the way upstairs, where one bedroom offers amazing treetop views and the other has a lovely dressing room. The bathroom in between has exposed brick and a claw-foot tub. An office/lounge, also brightened by skylights, comprises the top floor. This is an excellent commuter location with easy access to regional rail to New York and Philadelphia as well as Amtrak. Major highways serve the State Capital.

title: Relocating? Weekly rates starting at $620.
description:
A budget-friendly extended stay hotel in Bethlehem, PA
We invite you to experience the conveniences of home at WoodSpring Suites® Allentown Bethlehem. Our all-suite hotel with in-room kitchens is the perfect choice for your extended stay, whether it’s for a week, a month, or longer. We offer low nightly, weekly, and monthly hotel rates to help save you money. Plus, you'll enjoy free WiFi, guest laundry facilities and free parking at our 100% smoke-free, pet-friendly property, making your stay simple and hassle-free.
You'll enjoy quick access to a variety of destinations and attractions when you stay at our hotel in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. If you’d like to take advantage of public transportation, we're right on the 108, 217, 319, and 327 local LANta bus routes, while the Amtrak Bus Station is just 6 miles away. We're about 8 miles from the Lehigh Valley International Airport/ABE Airport. $50 to $100 Deposit.
Hotel at a Glance
5 miles to Lehigh Valley Hospital Muhlenberg
6 miles to St. Luke’s Hospital Anderson Campus
6 miles to Greyhound and Amtrak stations
8 miles to Lehigh Valley International Airport
Nightly, weekly and monthly hotel rates
Full kitchen in every room
Guest Rooms
Visit our extended stay hotel and select the suite layout that meets your needs. Each layout features a combination of double-/full-sized beds and sleeper sofas, as well as a dresser, nightstand and shelves. All suites also include a kitchen with full-size refrigerator, stovetop, microwave, cupboards and prep sink. Sit back and relax during your stay while enjoying free WiFi and a flat-screen TV with cable/satellite and a premium movie channel. Every-other-week housekeeping services are provided for long-stay guests. Additional items—including a linen exchange, cookware, dishes, and more frequent housekeeping—are available for purchase at the front desk.
Explore activities for all ages in Allentown Bethlehem
You're in the heart of it all when you stay at WoodSpring Suites in Allentown Bethlehem, where you'll find a variety of exciting attractions and destinations. History buffs will enjoy visiting the nearby Pennsbury Manor, the reconstructed estate of William Penn, who founded the Pennsylvania colony. We're also an easy drive to a number of family friendly activities, including Crayola Experience, Dorney Park and Wildwater Kingdom, and Lehigh Valley Zoo. Artists and creative types will want to check out the Banana Factory Arts Center, a collection of galleries and arts programs partly housed in a former banana distribution warehouse, about 9 miles away.
